Mason_Ramsey:
{{short description|American singer (born 2006)}} {{Use American English|date = September 2019}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2019}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Mason Ramsey | image = {{CSS image crop |Image = Mason Ramsey at Grammercy Theater.jpg |bSize = 500 |cWidth = 200 |cHeight = 270 |oTop = 200 |oLeft = 170 |Location = center }} | caption = Ramsey in 2024 | alias = Mason Blake | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|2006|11|16|}}{{Cite web |last=Lindsay |first=Jessica |date=2019-07-12 |title=Who is Mason Ramsey, the Walmart yodelling kid on the new Old Town Road remix? |url=https://metro.co.uk/2019/07/12/mason-ramsey-walmart-yodelling-kid-new-old-town-road-remix-10218169/ |access-date=2022-11-04 |website=Metro |language=en}} | birth_place = [[Golconda, Illinois]], U.S. | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Country music|Country]] * [[rockabilly]] * [[oldies]] * [[Christmas music|Christmas]] }} | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|voice actor}} | years_active = 2017–present | label = {{flatlist| * [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] * [[Big Loud]] }} | website = {{URL|https://masonramsey.com}} }} '''Mason Ramsey''' (born November 16, 2006) is an American singer. In March 2018, after gaining Internet fame from a [[viral video]] of him [[yodeling]] "[[Lovesick Blues]]" by [[Hank Williams]] at a [[Walmart]], Ramsey was signed to [[Big Loud]]. ==Career== In March 2018, 11-year-old{{Cite magazine|last=Bernstein|first=Jonathan|date=2018-08-27|title=Mason Ramsey: Inside the Curious Fame of 'Lil Hank Williams'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/mason-ramsey-inside-the-curious-fame-of-lil-hank-williams-716053/|access-date=2020-12-30|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US}} Mason Ramsey, from [[Golconda, Illinois]], was seen on camera singing "[[Lovesick Blues]]" in a [[Walmart]] store in [[Harrisburg, Illinois]]. Within a few days, videos of his performance collectively garnered over 25 million views and he became a viral sensation and [[internet meme]].{{Cite magazine|url=http://time.com/5225039/walmart-yodeling-boy-video-goes-viral/|title=The Internet Has Fallen Hard For This 10-Year-Old Boy Yodeling at Walmart|magazine=Time|access-date=April 5, 2018}} Ramsey's performance sparked new interest in [[Hank Williams]]' 70-year-old recording of the song and in March ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' reported that [[Spotify]]'s Viral 50 chart for the U.S. ranked Williams' "Lovesick Blues" at number three, and number four around the globe. As a result of his newfound fame Ramsey made an appearance on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''. Saying that his dream was to appear on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] one day, DeGeneres surprised Ramsey by saying he had been booked for the following weekend.{{cite web|last1=Betts|first1=Stephen|title=How Yodeling Walmart Kid Gave New Life to Hank Williams' 'Lovesick Blues'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/how-yodeling-walmart-kid-gave-new-life-to-lovesick-blues-w518952|website=RollingStone|date=April 10, 2018 |access-date=April 11, 2018}} On April 13, 2018, American DJ [[Whethan]] brought Ramsey out during his set at the 2018 [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival]] in Indio, California.{{cite web|last1=Alexander|first1=Bryan|title=Coachella 2018: Walmart yodeling kid Mason Ramsey wows music festival, Justin Bieber|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2018/04/13/coachella-2018-walmart-yodel-kid-mason-ramsey-music-festival/516455002/|website=USA Today|access-date=April 14, 2018}} In late April, he signed a record deal with [[Atlantic Records]] and Nashville-based label [[Big Loud Records|Big Loud]].{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8393343/yodeling-boy-atlantic-records-big-loud-famous-single|title=Yodeling Boy Signs With Atlantic Records & Big Loud, Releases 'Famous': Listen|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 28, 2018}} His debut single "[[Famous (Mason Ramsey song)|Famous]]" entered at number 62 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]],{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8455115/mason-ramsey-famous-country-charts-willie-nelson |title=Mason Ramsey, 11, Is Newly 'Famous' on Country Charts; Willie Nelson, 85, Still Is |last=Asker |first=Jim |date=May 8, 2018 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=May 8, 2018}} while the EP debuted in the top 10 of ''Billboard''{{'}}s Heatseekers Albums chart at number 7.{{cite magazine |title=Billboard Heatseekers Albums - Week of August 4th, 2018 |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/heatseekers-albums/2018-08-04 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=August 8, 2018}} Ramsey performed iconic number 1 songs on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart's 60th anniversary; starting from the 1960s, he sang hit songs by [[Mariah Carey]], [[Billy Joel]], [[Paul McCartney]], [[Stevie Wonder]], [[Celine Dion]], [[The Monkees]], [[The Jackson 5]], [[Whitney Houston]], [[Beyoncé]], and [[Adele]].{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8468423/mason-ramsey-sings-beyonce-whitney-houston-video|title=Watch Mason Ramsey Sing Beyoncé, Whitney Houston & More No. 1s Through the Decades|magazine=Billboard|access-date=August 15, 2018}} On June 8, 2018, he released his cover of "Lovesick Blues". On June 29, 2018, he released "Jambalaya (On the Bayou)" and "The Way I See It". On July 20, 2018, he released his debut extended play (EP), ''Famous''. He was featured on [[Lil Nas X]]'s third "[[Old Town Road]]" remix along with [[Billy Ray Cyrus]] and [[Young Thug]],{{Cite news |last=Frank |first=Allegra |date=July 12, 2019 |title=Lil Nas X's latest "Old Town Road" remix features Young Thug and the Walmart yodeling kid |work=[[Vox (website)|Vox]] |url=https://www.vox.com/culture/2019/7/12/20691728/old-town-road-remix-lil-nas-x-young-thug-mason-ramsey-walmart-yodeling-kid |access-date=July 23, 2023}} and joined Lil Nas X on stage to perform it at the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards]].{{Cite news |last=Martinelli |first=Marissa |date=January 26, 2020 |title=Lil Nas X Performed Every "Old Town Road" Remix at Once at the Grammys |work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |url=https://slate.com/culture/2020/01/grammys-lil-nas-x-old-town-road-performance-video.html |access-date=July 23, 2023}} In the same year, he was recognized as one of the YMCA's 15 under 15 for his contributions to country music.{{Cite web |title=Representative Mike Zalewski Receives the 2018 Legislative Hero Award |url=https://www.ymcachicago.org/greater-lagrange/news-events/representative-mike-zalewski-receives-the-2018-legislative-hero-award |access-date=2023-04-30 |website=YMCA |language=en}} After a hiatus since 2019, he did a [[Burger King]] commercial in which he yodels about cow-based [[methane emissions]] in 2020.{{Cite magazine|title=Mason Ramsey Yodels About Reducing Cow-Based Methane Emissions in New Burger King Commercial|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/9418491/mason-ramsey-burger-king-commercial|last=Mamo|first=Heran|date=July 15, 2020|access-date=September 21, 2021|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-P7VceH9F8|title=Burger King - Cow's Menu ft. Mason Ramsey|date=July 14, 2020 |via=YouTube}} Ramsey said he now plays basketball under the name Mason Blake, and that he plays on an outside court with friends.{{Cite AV media|url=https://open.spotify.com/episode/2tcSagxcoItQC9FDdMWCCp?si=tU9WNTP5TAW1WEnOIYsVDA&nd=1|title=Episode 111 YouBetchERN Radio W/ Mason Ramsey and Earnest|date=2021-03-24}} In 2022, Ramsey's song "Before I Knew It" from his 2019 EP ''Twang'' gained popularity on [[TikTok]] after he used it in several videos updating followers about his life, revealing he now works at [[Subway (restaurant)|Subway]].{{cite web|url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/yodel-boy-mason-ramsey-went-viral-in-walmart-before-i-knew-it-he-was-working-at-subway/|title='Yodel Boy' Mason Ramsey Went Viral In Walmart In 2018 & "Before I Knew It" He Was Working At Subway in 2022|website=Music Mayhem|last=Palsa|first=Nicole|date=January 29, 2022|access-date=February 4, 2022}} On June 30, 2023, Ramsey released the single "Reasons to Come Home", his first new music release in nearly four years.{{Cite magazine |last=Nicholson |first=Jessica |date=2023-06-05 |title=Mason Ramsey Pays Tribute to His Hometown With Upcoming Single, 'Reasons to Come Home' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/mason-ramsey-single-reasons-to-come-home-1235345672/ |access-date=2023-06-29 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}} On August 4, 2023, Ramsey released his second single this year, "She Got It Outta Me", a month after the release of the first single.{{Cite web |last=Chua |first=Jeremy |date=2023-08-04 |title=Mason Ramsey Gets an Unexpected Surprise in 'She Got It Outta Me' [Listen] |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/mason-ramsey-she-got-it-outta-me/ |access-date=2023-08-04 |website=Taste of Country |language=en-US}} On September 15, 2023, Ramsey released another song, "Next Right Thing", which, along with the previous two tracks released this year, included on his new EP.{{Cite magazine |last=Lorge |first=Melinda |date=2023-09-16 |title=LISTEN: Mason Ramsey Wants To Do The "Next Right Thing" In Optimistic New Single |url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/listen-mason-ramsey-wants-to-do-the-next-right-thing-in-optimistic-new-single/ |access-date=2023-09-16 |website=Music Mayhem Magazine |language=en-US}} All three songs released in 2023, along with two new songs "All I Wanna Be" and "Falls Into Place" were released as part of the new EP ''Falls Into Place'' on October 20, 2023, after four years from the release of the previous EP.{{Cite web |last=Rooten |first=Melanie |date=2023-10-19 |title=Mason Ramsey's New EP, 'Falls Into Place,' Showcases His Musical Evolution: 'This Is Not the Same Mason' |url=https://countrynow.com/mason-ramseys-new-ep-falls-into-place-showcases-his-musical-evolution-this-is-not-the-same-mason/ |access-date=2023-10-19 |website=Country Now |language=en-US}} On November 10, 2023, Mason Ramsey released a Christmas country cover of the song "[[Run Rudolph Run]]".{{Cite web |last=Smith |first=Emily |date=2023-12-13 |title=Where is Mason Ramsey, the kid who went viral for yodelling in a Walmart now? |url=https://thetab.com/uk/2023/12/13/where-is-mason-ramsey-the-kid-who-went-viral-for-yodelling-in-a-walmart-now-341907 |access-date=2023-12-13 |website=The Tab |language=en-UK}} On January 26, 2024, Ramsey released a new single, "Here All Day", followed by "Blue Over You" released on February 23, 2024.{{Cite web |last=White |first=Logan |date=2024-01-26 |title=Mason Ramsey Releases Heartfelt New Single "Here All Day" |url=https://substreammagazine.com/2024/01/mason-ramsey-releases-heartfelt-new-single-here-all-day/ |access-date=2024-01-26 |website=Substream Magazine |language=en-UK}}{{Cite web |last=Danforth |first=Libby |date=2024-02-28 |title=Mason Ramsey Is All Grown Up and Dropping Heartbreak Ballads — Hear 'Blue Over You' |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/mason-ramsey-blue-over-you/ |access-date=2024-02-28 |website=Taste of Country |language=en-US}} On April 26, 2024, Ramsey released his next single, "Something You Can Hold".{{cite web |title=Something You Can Hold - Single by Mason Ramsey |url=https://music.apple.com/kz/album/something-you-can-hold-single/1741414382 |website=[[Apple Music]] |access-date=2024-04-26}} On June 20, 2024, Ramsey performed with [[Lana Del Rey]] at [[Fenway Park]] during her stadium tour debut. They performed a duet of "Blue Over You".{{Cite web |last= Chelosky |first= Danielle | date=2024-06-20|title= Watch Lana Del Rey Bring Out Quavo, Mason Ramsey, & Stephen Sanchez At Nearly Rained-Out Fenway Concert|url=https://www.stereogum.com/2268970/watch-lana-del-rey-bring-out-quavo-and-mason-ramsey-fka-yodel-boy-at-nearly-rained-out-fenway-concert/news/ |access-date=2024-06-21}} On June 28, 2024, Ramsey released two singles: "All The Way To Memphis" and "How Do I Know If I'm In Love".{{Cite web |last=Iahn |first=Buddy |date=2024-06-21 |title=MASON RAMSEY ANNOUNCES TWO NEW SINGLES |url=https://themusicuniverse.com/mason-ramsey-announces-two-new-singles/ |access-date=2024-06-21 |website=themusicuniverse.com |language=en-US}} Ramsey released his debut album ''I'll See You In My Dreams'' on September 20, 2024.{{Cite web |url=https://holler.country/news/breaking/exclusive-mason-ramsey-premieres-cowboys-always-come-home-ahead-of-debut-album-i-ll-see-you-in-my-dreams/ |title=Mason Ramsey Premieres 'Cowboys Always Come Home' Ahead Of Debut Album I’ll See You In My Dream |date=2024-09-19 |website=Holler |last=Owen |first=Jof}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! Title !
